H0.text: Condensation is the process that allows water to move directly from a lake to the air.

H1.text: Evaporation is the process by which water moves directly from a lake to the air.

H2.text: Precipitation is the process by which water moves directly from a lake to the air.

H3.text: Sedimentation is the process by which water moves directly from a lake to the air.

A4.text: Evaporation is a type of vaporization that occurs on the surface of a liquid as it changes into the gas phase.

A5.text: Evaporation of water occurs when the surface of the liquid is exposed, allowing molecules to escape and form water vapor; this vapor can then rise up and form clouds.
